title: Falchion
data:
{{version031}} {{weapon |name = Falchion |cost = ? |weight = 17.0 |skill = Long Blades |damage = 8 |accuracy = +2 |basedelay = 13 (130%) |mindelay = 6 at skill 14 |size = Small |hands = 1H |ranged = No }} {{flavour|A long single-edged sword with a slightly curved blade. ---- "I have seen the day, with my good biting falchion
I would have made them skip; I am old now,
And these same crosses spoil me." -William Shakespeare, _King Leare_, V, iii. 1608.}} {{crawlquote|This weapon falls into the [[Long Blades]] category. It is a one handed weapon.}} The '''falchion''' is the lightest of the long blades, dealing less damage than the others in exchange for a slight boost to accuracy. It can be selected as a starting weapon for many [[background]]s. ==Strategy== Falchions have the best weapon stats of any "simple" starting weapon, just above the [[mace]]. Note that [[spear]]s will end up being better against single targets, due to their [[reaching]]. One (dis)advantage of [[Long Blades]] is that they scale with [[dexterity]] rather than [[strength]]. As a result, they are relatively better for a [[Dodging]]-focused character. Unless you find an exceptionally useful [[artifact]] falchion, you should upgrade to something else quickly. {| class="prettytable" style="border:none; margin:auto; padding:0; text-align: center" ! || Image |- | '''Mundane''' || [[File:Falchion1.png]] |- | '''Magical''' || [[File:Falchion2.png]] |- | '''Artifact''' || [[File:Falchion3.png]] |} ==History== *In [[0.28]], Long Blades lost [[riposte]]. Damage was increased back to pre-riposte levels. *In [[0.19]], Long Blades gained riposte. Falchions were reduced by 1 base damage to compensate. {{weapons}} [[Category:Long blades]]
